I read this once in an astronomy book but obviously have no way of checking it.

To draw a scale map of the solar system with the Earth at 1mm diameter would require a piece of paper 12km square.

I read this once in an astronomy book but obviously have no way of checking it.

To draw a scale map of the solar system with the Earth at 1mm diameter would require a piece of paper 12km square.

It can actually be checked quite easily using math. Earth has a diameter of ~12750 km, so this 'drawing' would have a scale of 1: 12 750 000 000. For simplicity let's round this up to 1: 13 billion. That means a 12km x 12km square would have a corresponding size of 156 x 156 billion kilometers. A bit big, actually.

Fun fact: You will not be able to fold that map 12(*) times in the middle to fit it into your pocket.
